help.introA: This tool helps you price handmade paper and small-batch goods by accounting for what most people forget:
help.introStrong: labor, waste, setup time, and overhead
help.introB: Fill in the inputs on the left; the right side updates automatically.
help.tip: Tip: Start simple (1–2 materials, one labor line) and then add detail until the unit cost feels realistic.

batchSize.title: Batch size
batchSize.body: How many sellable units you expect from the batch. If you’re making 10 sheets, enter 10.

materials.title: Materials
materials.body: Add every material used in the batch: cotton rag, abaca, sizing, pigment, flowers, packaging, etc. Use Qty × Unit cost per line.

labor.title: Labor
labor.body: Track your hands-on time. Split tasks if helpful (forming, couching, pressing, drying, trimming). Each line is Hours × Rate.

waste.title: Waste %
waste.body: Accounts for rejects, tears, color tests, misprints, or any loss. If 10% of units are unsellable, enter 10. Waste increases your true unit cost.

setup.title: Setup time
setup.body: One-time time you spend before the batch: pulling pulp, setting up screens, cleaning equipment, cutting templates. Setup is spread across the batch so you don’t underprice small runs.

overhead.title: Overhead %
overhead.body: A percentage to cover studio expenses that aren’t “materials”: rent, electricity, tool wear, admin time. If you’re unsure, start with 5–15%.

margin.title: Target margin %
margin.body: The profit margin you want on retail pricing. Higher margin gives you room for discounts, gallery cuts, and growth.

wholesale.title: Wholesale discount %
wholesale.body: Wholesale is typically a discount from retail for shops and galleries. Example: 50% discount = wholesale is half of retail.

fx.title: USD ↔ MXN exchange rate
fx.body: Used only for conversion display. We fetch a daily USD→MXN rate (with caching). You can override it if you’re selling to tourists, galleries, or using a specific exchange rate today.

products.title: Products & Specifications
products.p1: All products, content, specifications and prices are subject to change at any time without notice. We may make changes to designs depicted on this Website at any time if we determine such changes are necessary to improve or maintain the design and integrity of the product.
products.p2: We make all reasonable efforts to accurately display the attributes of our products, including all colors; however, the actual color you see will depend on your computer system and/or monitor.
products.p3: Due to the artisan nature of our products, there may be variations between items. We make no guarantee of a specific size, shape, color or performance of any of our products.

variations.title: Variations in Handmade Paper
variations.p1: Due to the one-of-a-kind nature of our handmade paper stock, product characteristics may vary widely. Variations in size, shape, color, printability and performance of handmade paper is to be expected.
variations.p2: This irregularity may extend to any and all artwork or designs printed on our handmade paper through any and all print methods. We consider this to be a positive characteristic and as such make no guarantee of a specific color, shape, size or performance of any handmade paper products.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.p1: Prices listed within our website are subject to change without notice.
pricing.p2: Despite our best efforts, items on the Website may occasionally be listed incorrectly. Amatl has the right to refuse or cancel any orders placed for products listed at the incorrect price. If the order is cancelled after payment has already been made, you will be credited immediately in the original amount and form of payment.

security.title: Security
security.p1: We take the utmost care and concern for your privacy while you are shopping on our site. We will never share or sell your information to any third party, and any information we collect is solely used to contact you about your order if necessary. Our site is fully secured using SSL encryption technology to ensure your personal information (especially your name, address, and credit card number) stays confidential and out of the wrong hands.

copyrights.title: Copyrights
copyrights.p1: All designs, products, and artwork depicted or described on this Website are protected by copyright and are the sole property of Amatl unless otherwise indicated. Under no circumstances may Amatl artwork be reproduced, duplicated or repurposed in any form or by any means, nor may derivative works be made.

handmadePaper.title: Handmade Paper Orders
handmadePaper.p1: We ship worldwide and regularly work with couples, businesses, and visitors planning projects from afar. In-stock paper items typically ship within 1–3 business days.
handmadePaper.p2: For made-to-order handmade paper, production timelines vary by season and volume. If you have an event date, we recommend reaching out early so we can confirm timing and options.

international.title: International Shipments
international.p1: Additional duties and taxes may be charged by your local customs authorities and are not included in your order total. We encourage you to research what fees may apply in your country.
international.p2: Customs processing times can vary. If you need delivery by a specific date, we recommend choosing a tracked service and ordering with extra buffer time.

hero.title: Make handmade paper + prints in San Miguel de Allende
hero.subtitle: A calm, hands-on studio session—something different to do while visiting the town. You’ll make sheets of paper and create prints to take home.
hero.note: Each session includes papermaking and printmaking (linocut). Depending on availability, we may also offer introductory etching as an add-on.

feature.headline: Handmade paper + linocut printing—crafted by you, guided by us.

details.paragraph: Workshops are designed for visitors and locals who want a tactile, art-forward experience. We keep groups small and the pace relaxed—focused on learning, making, and leaving with something real.

paper.title: Handmade paper
paper.description: Pull sheets from pulp, explore deckled edges, and learn how inclusions (flowers, grasses, fibers) change texture and strength.

lino.title: Linocut printing
lino.description: Carve a simple block, ink it, and print a small edition—on studio paper and/or your freshly pulled sheets (as time allows).

optionalEtching.title: Optional: introductory etching
optionalEtching.description: When available, add a light intro to etching—basic prep and printing—ideal for curious beginners.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Most sessions run 2–3 hours. Private sessions can be longer for deeper focus or larger groups.

included.title: Included
included.description: All materials and tools are provided: pulp, inclusions, paper, inks, brayers, carving tools, and a studio apron.

level.title: Skill level
level.description: Beginner-friendly. We’ll guide each step and adjust projects to your comfort level.

booking.title: Booking
booking.description: Reserve ahead for travel dates. We can also plan private groups for celebrations, retreats, or visiting artists.
